oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Dan Seals Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Dan Seals (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Dan Seals; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Dan Seals thanks Biff Collie for having him on the Music City Album review, and Seals introduces his album Rage On -- (00:10) "Big Wheels in the Moonlight" is discussed by Seals as a true story; Seals says listening to trucks in the night inspired the song -- (01:00) Seals reflects on the idea of different decisions people make on "They Rage On" -- (01:35) Seals reflects on his decision to name his album, Rage On, based on the power of it name -- (02:24) Seals uses "Five Generations of Rock County Wilsons" to describe his constant search for new songs --(03:01) Seals discusses how he seeks out music with "moral guidance" -- (03:41) Collie and Seals discuss Mac McAnally's personality; additionally, Seals describes the circumstances behind meeting with McAnally for "Twenty-Four Hour Love" -- (04:33) Seals recalls working while being a union member; this work would be the inspiration for "Factory Town" -- (05:22) Seals talks about the success of "Addicted" and how he had an immediate infatuation for the song -- (05:58) Seals describes the meaning of an extraordinary title -- (07:00) "A Heartache Just Around the Bend" writer Paul Davis is discussed by Seals and Collie, and Seals describes the tempo of the song -- (07:57) Seals jokes on the need for artists to jump on new songs as quickly as possible -- (09:15) Seals describes recording and touring as the easy components of his job -- (09:36) Seals reflects on the different ways which songs can be influenced lyrically
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Seals, Dan; Collie, Biff;
